Description: Ensure proper authorization checks on all protected resources
Why It Matters: #1 vulnerability in OWASP Top 10 2025 - allows unauthorized access to data
How to Fix: Implement RBAC, validate permissions server-side on every request

Description: Ensure all sensitive data is encrypted at rest and in transit
Why It Matters: Exposure of sensitive data like passwords and API keys
How to Fix: Use TLS 1.3 enforce HTTPS and encrypt database columns with sensitive data

Description: Prevent SQL XSS and command injection attacks
Why It Matters: Attackers can execute malicious code or access unauthorized data
How to Fix: Use parameterized queries, sanitize user input, implement CSP

Description: Implement security by design with threat modeling
Why It Matters: Architectural flaws cannot be fixed with good implementation
How to Fix: Conduct threat modeling, implement defense in depth, use secure defaults

Description: Remove debug mode and default credentials in production
Why It Matters: Verbose errors expose sensitive information to attackers
How to Fix: Disable debug mode, remove default passwords, configure security headers properly

Description: Keep all dependencies updated and scan for vulnerabilities
Why It Matters: Known vulnerabilities in dependencies can be exploited
How to Fix: Run npm audit regularly, use Dependabot, pin dependency versions
Code Example:
# Check for vulnerabilities
npm audit
# Auto-fix what's possible
npm audit fix
# Update all dependencies
npm update
